SanarbiaTesting: ^SANARBIA: Ah... You’ve come back. I see that your search for the three titled ones was successful...
^SANARBIA: Heh... Fear not, nothing around here gets past me...
^SANARBIA: Cielle, Cosmo, the pair of you have done well to welcome the Aster Festival’s people into your hearts...
^SANARBIA: I shall keep my part of the promise... What would you like to know about our origins? Be warned, I tend to ramble...
Races: ^CIELLE: The four tribes that come to this festival... We’ve never seen anyone like this back on our planet...
^CIELLE: What’s the history of everyone around here?
^SANARBIA: Yes, our appearances are slightly different compared to yours...
^SANARBIA: You see, in a time long forgotten, the residents of this very planet we’re standing on let their home go to ruin...
^SANARBIA: They choked the planet’s clean springs. They burnt all the world’s lush greenery. They polluted all the sweet air.
^SANARBIA: I believe they called the planet... Earth.
^SANARBIA: One day, an asteroid was found hurling towards the planet at an immense speed...
^SANARBIA: It was then that a miracle happened...
^SANARBIA: The asteroid entered the world’s atmosphere and disintegrated into a fine dust that blanketed the entire planet...
^SANARBIA: This meteor was not one that brought death, but rather, it brought the gift of life...
^SANARBIA: This interstellar dust began to rapidly mutate the world, and all forms of life began to flourish.
^SANARBIA: Some plants and animals were heavily affected from the meteor's gift, causing them to rapidly evolve...
^SANARBIA: You see... the four races you have found around here... Our ancestors came from these gifted flora and fauna...
^SANARBIA: That is how the Pluvia, Navemar, Marquina and Calmaaj came to be...
Market: ^CIELLE: The temples... and this land that this festival is held at, what's the history behind them?
^SANARBIA: In an age long forgotten, there stood a laboratory that studied celestial objects right where the fountain now stands behind me.
^SANARBIA: They performed all sorts of wonderful experiments on asteroids, meteors and meteorites...
^SANARBIA: They were researching their properties and extracting minerals and oils from them...
^SANARBIA: When the asteroid plummeting towards the planet entered the atmosphere, some pieces remained intact on their descent.
^SANARBIA: It was recorded that a large piece struck the now-abandoned lab, reducing it to mere rubble, before the piece itself turned to dust.
^SANARBIA: This great impact dispersed the celestial oils and minerals the scientists were procuring...
^SANARBIA: Now imbued with the great asteroid’s life-giving gifts, oils and minerals flew towards the east and west.
^SANARBIA: These oils and minerals imbued themselves into the lands and waters...
^SANARBIA: That is how two great forces came to exist in such close proximity to one another.
^SANARBIA: The oils seeped into the western grounds, and a large hollow tree blossomed as the first Pluvian Elder grew in its midst...
^SANARBIA: The minerals steeped into the eastern waters, and a structure emerged from the sea as the Great Spirit of the Cove began to come alive...
^SANARBIA: With these two forces residing in one location, these grounds and waters are ever prosperous...
^SANARBIA: This is why we hold the Aster Festival here, as it is a reminder of the miracle in the way these lands right here came to be.
^CIELLE: Wow, that’s really amazing to hear...
^COSMO: I don’t believe in miracles, but that sure does sound like one...
Festival: ^CIELLE: So what is the festival specifically celebrating?
^SANARBIA: In an era long forgotten, 'humans' were faced with the threat of an oncoming asteroid.
^SANARBIA: With little time before imminent death, only those with wealth and power were luxurious enough to have the chance to flee.
^SANARBIA: They took off in rockets, and left all other forms of life to perish on an already dying planet.
^SANARBIA: Those that remained on the planet hid deep underground in bunkers to protect themselves from the impact.
^SANARBIA: A handful of years passed, and resources began to get scarce and curiosity got the better of them...
^SANARBIA: They then emerged from their underground haven, to quite a shock.
^SANARBIA: Instead of finding a barren wasteland like they had feared, the humans were presented with a brand new, flourishing world...
^SANARBIA: Their former home now had new life forms that they had never seen before...and some did not take to our ancestors kindly.
^SANARBIA: A portion of the human population gladly joined these newer life forms in living in these lands...
^SANARBIA: But, a faction bid war against them to take the land back for themselves.
^SANARBIA: Years passed with the humans rebelling against the Pluvian and Navemar ancestors and those who joined them.
^SANARBIA: Their resistance and hostility to our ancestors was getting them nowhere, and only made them miserable.
^SANARBIA: They decided to join the new life forms in peace and share the spoils of this flourishing world.
^SANARBIA: It was then that a peace treaty between the Pluvian and Navemar ancestors alongside the humans was forged...
^SANARBIA: A celebration was held every year after to celebrate the unification of these parties: the Aster Festival.
^SANARBIA: Many generations later, the creatures of the new world and the humans of the old, are now one...
^SANARBIA: The Aster Festival celebrates the unification of all life around these lands...
^SANARBIA: It celebrates how our ancestors had collaboratively turned a dark past into a bright future.
^CIELLE: And to think that this whole festival started from a conflict!
^COSMO: I better make more of a scene some day to get a festival dedicated to myself...
FinalKnot: ^CIELLE: Wow, I never thought that this festival and the people around it would have such a rich history...
^COMSO: Right?! And to think it’s all thanks to a meteor...
^CIELLE: Yeah, it’s like you and I were destined to attend this festival...
^CIELLE: Yeah! Cosmo’s called ‘Cosmo’ for a reason!
^COSMO: COSMO - Celestial Object Scanner: Meteorite Observer. That sort of stuff is my specialty!
^SANARBIA: In that case, I have something I would like to give the two of you...
^SANARBIA: It’s a small meteorite. It’s not of the kind that started everything for us here, but I believe you will enjoy it nonetheless.
^CIELLE: That’s amazing! You didn’t have to!
^COSMO: I’m gonna scan that meteorite so thoroughly!
^SANARBIA: Think of it as a token from everyone here... a memento of sorts for you to remember us by.
^SANARBIA: I’ve placed it just where you entered the market grounds...
^SANARBIA: If you wish for your time here at the Aster Festival to come to an end, head on to the meteorite.
